verses.verse: so that he will not give any of them the flesh of his children whom he will eat, because he has nothing left in the siege and desperate straits in which your enemy shall distress you at all your gates.

The tender and delicate woman among you, who would not venture to set the sole of her foot on the ground because of her delicateness and sensitivity, will refuse to the husband of her bosom, and to her son and her daughter,

her placenta which comes out (Gen. 49:10) from between her feet and her children whom she bears; for she will eat them secretly for lack of everything in the siege and desperate straits in which your enemy shall distress you at all your gates.
“If you do not carefully observe all the words of this law that are written in this book, that you may fear (Ex. 6:3) this glorious and awesome name, THE LORD YOUR GOD,
then the LORD will bring upon you and your descendants (Dan. 9:12) extraordinary plagues—great and prolonged plagues—and serious and prolonged sicknesses.
Moreover He will bring back on you all (Deut. 7:15) the diseases of Egypt, of which you were afraid, and they shall cling to you.
Also every sickness and every plague, which is not written in this Book of the Law, will the LORD bring upon you until you are destroyed.
You (Deut. 4:27) shall be left few in number, whereas you were (Deut. 10:22; Neh. 9:23) as the stars of heaven in multitude, because you would not obey the voice of the LORD your God.

And it shall be, that just as the LORD (Deut. 30:9; Jer. 32:41) rejoiced over you to do you good and multiply you, so the LORD (Prov. 1:26; (Is. 1:24)) will rejoice over you to destroy you and bring you to nothing; and you shall be (Jer. 12:14; 45:4) plucked from off the land which you go to possess.

“Then the LORD (Lev. 26:33; Deut. 4:27, 28; Neh. 1:8; Jer. 16:13; Amos 9:9) will scatter you among all peoples, from one end of the earth to the other, and (Deut. 28:36) there you shall serve other gods, which neither you nor your fathers have known—wood and stone.

And (Lam. 1:3; Amos 9:4) among those nations you shall find no rest, nor shall the sole of your foot have a resting place; (Lev. 26:36) but there the LORD will give you a trembling heart, failing eyes, and (Lev. 26:16) anguish of soul.
Your life shall hang in doubt before you; you shall fear day and night, and have no assurance of life.

(Job 7:4) In the morning you shall say, ‘Oh, that it were evening!’ And at evening you shall say, ‘Oh, that it were morning!’ because of the fear which terrifies your heart, and (Deut. 28:34) because of the sight which your eyes see.

“And the LORD (Jer. 43:7; Hos. 8:13) will take you back to Egypt in ships, by the way of which I said to you, (Deut. 17:16) ‘You shall never see it again.’ And there you shall be offered for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you.”

(The Covenant Renewed in Moab) These are the words of the (Lev. 26:46; Deut. 5:2, 3) covenant which the LORD commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, besides the covenant which He made with them in Horeb.

Now Moses called all Israel and said to them: (Ex. 19:4; Deut. 11:7) “You have seen all that the LORD did before your eyes in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and to all his servants and to all his land—
(Deut. 4:34; 7:19) the great trials which your eyes have seen, the signs, and those great wonders.
Yet ((Is. 6:9, 10; Ezek. 12:2); Matt. 13:14; (Acts 28:26, 27); Rom. 11:8; (Eph. 4:18)) the LORD has not given you a heart to perceive and eyes to see and ears to hear, to this very day.
(Deut. 1:3; 8:2) And I have led you forty years in the wilderness. (Deut. 8:4) Your clothes have not worn out on you, and your sandals have not worn out on your feet.
(Ex. 16:12; Deut. 8:3) You have not eaten bread, nor have you drunk wine or similar drink, that you may know that I am the LORD your God.
And when you came to this place, (Num. 21:23, 24; Deut. 2:26—3:3) Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan came out against us to battle, and we conquered them.
We took their land and (Num. 32:33; Deut. 3:12, 13) gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, to the Gadites, and to half the tribe of Manasseh.
Therefore (Deut. 4:6; 1 Kin. 2:3) keep the words of this covenant, and do them, that you may (Josh. 1:7) prosper in all that you do.
“All of you stand today before the LORD your God: your leaders and your tribes and your elders and your officers, all the men of Israel,
your little ones and your wives—also the stranger who is in your camp, from (Josh. 9:21, 23, 27) the one who cuts your wood to the one who draws your water—
that you may enter into covenant with the LORD your God, and (Neh. 10:29) into His oath, which the LORD your God makes with you today,

that He may (Deut. 28:9) establish you today as a people for Himself, and that He may be God to you, (Ex. 6:7) just as He has spoken to you, and (Gen. 17:7, 8) just as He has sworn to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
“I make this covenant and this oath, ((Jer. 31:31; Heb. 8:7, 8)) not with you alone,
but with him who stands here with us today before the LORD our God, (Acts 2:39) as well as with him who is not here with us today
